entry.content:
Becoming Otherwise

Everything is changing and becoming what they were not before. 

Becoming Otherwise

Things will become what they are not.

Thought will become what they are not.

The meaning we give to our experiences will become what they are not.

Becoming Otherwise

Thought is not going to persist. New ideas are coming above it. 

Becoming Otherwise

The relationships we cling to are changing and becoming what they were not. 

Meaning we see in this world is becoming Otherwise. 

Whatever has the nature of appearing will disappear. 

Whatever has the nature of being born will die. 

What comes will go. 

Nothing persists. 

Everything, every experience, is becoming otherwise. 

 

Becoming Otherwise

entry.content:
Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story.

We usually tell the story to ourselves, which makes us feel special; in the story in which everyone loves us, I am the one, To whom everyone should care about.

Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story. 

We have justification for all the moves we have made. Sometimes we create assumptions about ourselves ( which need not be true)  to justify our desires and actions.

Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story. 

These assumptions justify ourselves so we would be the good person in our story. These stories are the explanation of what we did. Sometimes they are far from reality. Since it's not true, one day when we realize that we are not who we thought, it puts us on the ground; we know this situation is an "existential crisis." It is when thoughts and observations collide with the need to update our beliefs.

Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story. 

These assumptions we made to justify ourselves. Through this, we form our personality. Since we want to be good in that story { we told ourselves}. We have to behave according to the assumptions we have made. There are some examples of these assumptions.

  1. I love you
  2. I hate you
  3. I am dumb
  4. We are friends
  5. I have a high temper
  6. Yes, but I am like that
  7. I am introvert
  8. I don't go and talk first

and many more...

Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story. 

So what do we do?

So what story should I tell ourselves?

I don't know why we even tell a story to ourselves. 

Why should we have to tell a story to ourselves in the first place? 

I want you to think. Why did we tell stories to ourselves why?

entry.content:
This is the list of questions that makes me carry on. 

  1. Why do we exist? 

  2. Do People Have Free Will? 

  3. Is Nature Moving Towards Dissolution Or Integration?

  4. What Gives Life Its Meaning?

  5. Why Do We Create Art?

  6. Does Time Have A Beginning Or An End?

  7. Is Our Universe 'Real'?

  8. How Do You Explain Consciousness?

  9. What, Exactly, Makes You… You?

  10. If The Only Thing I Know Is That I Know Nothing, Do I Know Something?

  11.  If I Were Omnipotent, Could I Create A Rock So Heavy I Couldn't Lift It?

  12. If Every Cell In My Body Gets Replaced Over 7 Years, Will I Still Be Me In 7 Years?

  13. If No One Observes An Event, Did It Happen?

  14. Why is there something rather than nothing?
